name: Lugano
fun_fact: Fun fact: Lugano is Switzerland's 'Italian soul' - the Italian-speaking Ticino canton enjoys Mediterranean warmth, palm trees, and Italian cuisine while maintaining Swiss precision and those famous Swiss bank accounts.

hero_dishes.name: Risotto with Porcini Mushrooms
hero_dishes.description: Creamy Arborio rice cooked with wild porcini mushrooms from Ticino forests, finished with local cheese
hero_dishes.origin_story: Ticino's position between Swiss Alps and Italian lakes creates perfect conditions for porcini mushrooms. The Swiss-Italian hybrid cuisine takes Italian risotto technique and adds Ticino's foraged mushrooms and alpine cheeses. It's the best of both worlds - Italian technique meets Swiss precision and local ingredients.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Traditional grottos and restaurants throughout Lugano - reviews mention excellent Risotto Porcini at various establishments

hero_dishes.name: Polenta with Meat
hero_dishes.description: Creamy cornmeal polenta topped with slow-braised meat (ossobuco, sausage, or horse steak), often with melted cheese
hero_dishes.origin_story: Polenta is Ticino comfort food - peasant dish elevated to regional pride. The cornmeal mush becomes vehicle for rich meat ragÃ¹s and local cheeses. Grotto del Pep is famous for tender ribs with polenta and flavorful horse steak - yes, horse meat is traditional in Ticino.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Grotto del Pep (Carabbia hillside village - classic Ticinese grotto, exceptional meat dishes including horse steak and ribs with polenta), Grotto Morchino (cozy stone-walled eatery for authentic Ticino cuisine)

hero_dishes.name: Ossobuco
hero_dishes.description: Braised veal shanks cooked until falling off the bone, served with risotto or polenta
hero_dishes.origin_story: This Milanese classic crossed into Ticino and became local specialty. The marrow-filled bone gives ossobuco its name ('bone with a hole'). Lugano chefs braise it for hours until spoon-tender, creating rich, gelatinous sauce that pairs perfectly with polenta or risotto.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Grotto del Pep (lamb ossobuco with polenta is incredible), traditional restaurants - reviews rave about ossobuco preparations throughout Lugano

hero_dishes.name: Local Sausages and Charcuterie
hero_dishes.description: Ticinese salametti, mortadella, and other cured meats with local character
hero_dishes.origin_story: Ticino's mountain air and Italian heritage create perfect conditions for curing meats. Local charcuterie boards showcase salametti (small salami), bresaola (air-dried beef), and Ticino-style mortadella. It's Italian salumi making with Swiss quality standards.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Charcuterie boards at grottos and restaurants, local markets, wine bars throughout Lugano

signature_drinks.name: Ticino Merlot
signature_drinks.description: Local Merlot wine from Ticino's sun-soaked vineyards - Switzerland's Italian wine region
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Ticino is Switzerland's wine country, producing excellent Merlot. Locals drink it with meals - it pairs perfectly with polenta and meat dishes. A bottle costs 70-90 CHF at restaurants but it's quality worth the Swiss prices. The warm Ticino climate creates robust, food-friendly wines.

signature_drinks.name: Grappa
signature_drinks.description: Pomace brandy distilled from grape skins - strong digestif in Italian tradition
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Served after rich meals as digestivo. Ticino's Italian heritage means grappa culture is strong. It's fire water that aids digestion after heavy polenta and meat dishes. Often homemade by local families.

food_culture_notes: Grottos are Ticino's traditional restaurants - stone-walled, rustic, serving hearty local dishes. They're the real deal.
Menus are relatively limited at traditional grottos, but everything is done to perfection - quality over quantity
Wine is expensive (70-90 CHF for local Merlot) but quality is excellent - this is Switzerland after all
Reservations essential for popular spots, especially busy weekend nights. Grotto del Pep requires car or bus 434 from Paradiso
